text: This ‚ô•Ô∏è is for @aranoff, and so is the big squishy one in my chest.ü´Ä https://t.co/3gdQaxJfW5
@haahr Based on /usr/dict/words, I liked TARES, COULD, then PINKY. It turns out the Wordle list drops all (?) the plural words that end in S. So putting S in the final slot was a complete waste. üôÉ

@haahr I went down a similar analysis path on /usr/dict/words, until I discovered that Wordle has a set of (common) words that can be the solution, and a (wider) set of exotic words that can be used as guesses: https://t.co/lN7Hl5aZUE
@shikibmehri please tell me that TARES scores well, because that's my cornerstone based on letter frequency, plus the odds of 'e' at the fourth slot and 's' as the final letter. :)

@shikibmehri Fun stuff! For your first word, did you constrain yourself to only five letter words when calculating letter frequencies? Doing that with /usr/dict/words, S was more frequent than T for me. If you're trying to maximize matches with the first word, would that lead to AROSE?

Today was my first Canadian snow day! Thanks to @aranoff for introducing me to this beast of a winter.

Tomorrow's experiment is maple syrup taffy on the snow in our backyard.

I'm thankful to @aranoff for introducing me to the tradition of "pumpkin parades" on a recent date night.

The day after Halloween, many folks in Toronto bring their pumpkins to outdoor parks. It's a safe way to bring a community together and share some fun. https://t.co/OCtl5xGYOz
@aranoff @RojoPup @RojoPup responds well to positive affirmation, and this picture is a good reminder. Thanks for sharing this. :)

At the end of April, I'm stepping down as Administrator of the U.S. Digital Service.

It's such an incredible group of people, and I'm grateful for my time working alongside them. More info: https://t.co/xJ7VCfuxDW

Huge congrats to @ClareMartorana on becoming the next Federal CIO. She's kind, empathetic, and cares most about getting good things done for people. I couldn't be more excited about Clare taking on this role.
Black lives matter.

Just thinking this morning about how great it is that Colorado is creating a Colorado Digital Service to improve its services to the public. And that more and more states are looking to improve their services with human-centered design and technology.

This is a huge move forward to improve security in the US government. A vulnerability disclosure policy provides a way for folks outside government to report security issues that they find.
@cephalobloop Okay, I got the Google Pixelbook Go (Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i5 16GB RAM 128GB Storage Full HD Display) Just Black

I had forgotten that you can run a battery test on Chromebooks. Use <control>-<alt>-t to open a crosh window, then type

battery_test 30

to run a 30 second test and to see your Chromebook's battery health.
@cephalobloop The one that was on the waitlist that just came off a waitlist? I think the top-end one is still waitlisted?

My short Pixel 4 XL review:
- Nice phone
- The people in charge of porting settings/apps from one phone to the next *really* nailed it.
- Thicker w/more battery life please. Don't need thinner. 
- I miss the fast/explicit unlock of the fingerprint sensor. Face unlock too finicky.

My short Pixelbook Go review:
- Screen should be 3:2 aspect ratio, not 16:9
- Needs a USB-A port
- Keyboard is excellent
- Not as nice/sturdy as Chromebook Pixel 2015

#ChromebookPixel2015ForLife
Seven benefits that Veterans might overlook: https://t.co/A4yoJdz2x9
@ronilan @neyne @paultoo the specific situation with Totlol, but that's my best estimate of what I was trying to say ten years ago.

@ronilan @neyne @paultoo or legal or internationalization or wherever. In many of the cases I saw, someone assumed that Google took some action in response to them or their site or their comments, when I knew from my position that the action had been percolating for months. Again, I don't know/recall

@ronilan @neyne @paultoo For example, people often assumed that a change with Google was a deliberate reaction to an immediate stimuli. At least in my experience, changes often took weeks (or more often months) to wend their way through levels of approval, consultation with other groups, potentially PR..

@ronilan @neyne @paultoo Thanks for pointer. I don't have/recall the inside word on any of that situation. What I did see many times were people attributing malice (or even just intent) on the timing of when something happens like "I started advertising with AdWords and then my site dropped in rankings."
